pullRequest.body:
From sphere-eversion. While I'm in the area,

- remove `image_isOpen_of_isOpen`, which is an exact duplicate of `isOpen_image_of_subset_source`
- rename `image_isOpen_of_isOpen'` to `isOpen_image_source_inter_of_isOpen` (which matches the naming convention)
- move `isOpen_inter_preimage_symm` next to its adjacent lemmas

nodes.body:
I see an argument that the later-occuring lemmas were present before the port, hence should be preferred.
However, the earlier lemmas have a different naming scheme, also used in sphere-eversion. I guess I'm asking "which name is better".
@ocfnash I think you wrote this back in sphere-eversion.
Updated the code and the top-level comment; this is ready again. Thanks for the quick look.
When renaming lemmas, I believe we're now leaning towards leaving a deprecated alias with the old name in place for a while.

> When renaming lemmas, I believe we're now leaning towards leaving a deprecated alias with the old name in place for a while.

There is no formal requirement (at least, yet), though downstream users will definitely appreciate this.

> > When renaming lemmas, I believe we're now leaning towards leaving a deprecated alias with the old name in place for a while.
> 
> There is no formal requirement (at least, yet), though downstream users will definitely appreciate this.

Some data: this had exactly two uses in mathlib (both changed in this PR) and four uses in sphere-eversion. I think that's mild enough to not bother with this, at the moment.

I think it's worth implementing Yury's naming improvement [here](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/9623#discussion_r1448066450) and then this is ready to merge.

Thanks!

bors d+

:v: grunweg can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).

Thanks, @ocfnash and @urkud for the fast reviews!
bors r+

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7487391603/job/20379691628)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7487391603/job/20379691403)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/7487391603/job/20379691143)

We usually prefer the RHS to be the simpler form (when this makes sense):
```suggestion
    IsOpen (e '' s)  IsOpen s  := by
```
We should just excise this lemma since it is an exact duplicate of `PartialHomeomorph.isOpen_image_of_subset_source`.
Sure: except that this lemma was first. Which name do you prefer?
I prefer `PartialHomeomorph.isOpen_image_of_subset_source` since it is available earlier and is correctly named.

Are you saying this duplicates a lemma?

If we're keeping it it should be renamed to `isOpen_image_source_inter_of_isOpen`.
Renamed. (I meant a different lemma, clarified now.)
I don't think that we need `_of_isOpen` here, since there is no other reasonable assumption.
@ocfnash :arrow_up: ?
@urkud agreed.
Please add the symmetric version `(s  e.source)  IsOpen (e '' s)  IsOpen s`.
That already exists as `isOpen_image_iff_of_subset_source`. :-)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: two lemmas about partial homeomorphisms
